resources.title: How and Why to Use LGBTQ+ Inclusive Language in Psychology.
resources.description: In this guidebook, we raise awareness and help inform readers and mental health professionals about inclusive language best practices, why inclusive language is crucial for people's mental health, and how the LGBTQ+ community can be affected by the language  we choose to use in our practice and daily communication. We worked with David Alonzo, a GLSEN certified professional development facilitator, to create this in-depth resource and to provide our readers with the best tips for developing inclusive language  skills.

resources.description: Gender Outlaw was decades ahead of its time when it was first published in 1994. resources.title: A Quick and Easy Guide to They/Them Pronouns by Archie Bongiovanni and Tristan Jimerson
resources.description: Archie, a snarky genderqueer artist, is tired of people not understanding gender neutral pronouns. Tristan, a cisgender dude, is looking for an easy way to introduce gender neutral pronouns to his increasingly diverse workplace. The longtime best friends team up in this short and fun comic guide that explains what pronouns are, why they matter, and how to use them.
